intro: Sterculia tiliacea, commonly known as the African tamarind tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The tree produces woody pods containing edible seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves are also valued for their medicinal properties, including anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial effects. The plant is well adapted to dry climates and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
